alert.note: Alert for Estill; Lee; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Powell, east central Estill, north central Lee and west central Wolfe Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pilot, or 8 miles southeast of Stanton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fixer and Bowen around 645 PM EDT. Standing Rock and Lombard around 650 PM EDT. Leeco, Zachariah and Zoe around 655 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Slade, Nada, Natural Bridge S.P., Glencairn, Torrent, Whisman, Koomer Ridge Campground, Jenson, Pine Ridge and Rogers. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 26 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
